title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E runs from Sept. 12 to 28 in West Springfield, featuring state fair foods and regional specialties.
The What the Fluff? Festival in Somerville on Sept. 20 celebrates Marshmallow Fluff with games and live music.
Damariscotta Pumpkinfest in Maine from Oct. 10-13 includes a pumpkin parade, weigh-off, and boat regatta.

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, Emmy nominee for 'Somebody Somewhere,' joins the latest Love Letters podcast episode.
Hiller shares a personal breakup story from his 20s, highlighting lessons learned from a past romance.
The episode explores themes in romance with references to films like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill.'

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to murdering and kidnapping his 38-year-old sister, Michelle Knox, in Lynn District Court.
Police responded to a Newhall Street apartment in Lynn where Smith allegedly made statements about killing his sister.
Smith has a criminal history, including a guilty plea to assault with a dangerous weapon and prior acquittals on other charges.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry III recorded 2.5 sacks against the Raiders, contributing to the team's defensive efforts.
New England's defense, bolstered by offseason signings, showed promise despite the 20-13 loss to Las Vegas.
Raiders' Geno Smith threw for 362 yards, highlighting areas for improvement in the Patriots' pass defense.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews was disappointed with the Patriots' poor run game performance against the Raiders at Gillette Stadium.
The Patriots managed only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, averaging 3.3 yards per carry in the loss.
Drake Maye attempted 46 passes, indicating a shift from New England's expected ground-focused offensive strategy.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm to run his first Bruins training camp on September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena in Hanover.
Sturm emphasizes intensity, accountability, and new standards as key messages for upcoming Bruins training camp.
Key to Bruins' success will be improving defense, power play, and leveraging opportunities for all players in Olympic year.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert faces charges including kidnapping, rape, and attempted murder in Worcester, Massachusetts, dating back to 2017.
A Worcester girl, now 15, testified about the alleged 2017 kidnapping and assault by family friend Joshua Hubert.
Despite Hubert's claims of innocence, the trial includes evidence and testimony about the Lake Quinsigamond incident.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye addressed concerns about his workload after the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders, asserting it's manageable.
Patriots' offense struggled after halftime against the Raiders, exacerbated by a pivotal interception thrown by Maye.
Maye commented on Belichick banning Patriots scouts from UNC, saying it's unfortunate but supports his former team.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell struggled in his Patriots debut, facing penalties and pressure late in the game.
Veteran Morgan Moses advised Campbell that early career struggles are common and part of learning in the NFL.
The Patriots' offensive line allowed four sacks and two false starts attributed to Campbell in their 13-point game.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte, once a top prospect compared to Stefon Diggs, was drafted in the sixth round by the Patriots.
Boutte's standout performance in the Patriots' opener includes six catches for 103 yards and five first-downs.
An ankle injury during his sophomore year at LSU affected Boutte's draft stock, but he remains confident in his abilities.
